title: 108_s1792
content: The Act may be cited as the "Art and Collectibles Capital Gains Tax Treatment Parity Act" and it pertains to the capital gains treatment for art and collectibles. SEC. 2. CAPITAL GAINS TREATMENT FOR ART AND COLLECTIBLES. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to change the maximum capital gains rate. Defines '28-percent rate gain' and specifies the effective date for the amendment. SEC. 3. CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS OF CERTAIN ITEMS CREATED BY THE TAXPAYER. Amendment to section 170 of the Internal Revenue Code allows for special rules regarding contributions of literary, musical, artistic, or scholarly compositions. Fair market value of the property contributed is considered, with no reduction in the amount of contribution. The amendment to section 170 of the Internal Revenue Code allows for special rules for qualified artistic charitable contributions, including literary, musical, artistic, or scholarly compositions created by the taxpayer at least 18 months prior to the contribution. A qualified appraisal of the fair market value of the property is required for such contributions. The taxpayer must obtain a qualified appraisal for the contribution of property, attach it to their tax return, and ensure the donee organization's use of the property is related to its exempt purpose under section 501 of the Internal Revenue Code. The taxpayer must receive a written statement from the donee ensuring the property will be used in accordance with tax code provisions. The written appraisal must show evidence of similar property owned, maintained, and displayed by qualifying organizations. The increase in the deduction under this section is limited to the taxpayer's artistic adjusted gross income for the taxable year and cannot be carried over to future years. The term 'artistic adjusted gross income' refers to the portion of a taxpayer's adjusted gross income attributable to income from personal efforts related to the sale of property or from activities like teaching or performing. This does not apply to certain contributions like letters or memoranda. The amendment made by this section applies to charitable contributions of letters, memoranda, or similar property written by an individual while serving as an officer or employee, excluding personal items. For qualified artistic contributions, the tangible property and copyright are treated separately. The amendment made by this section applies to charitable contributions of letters, memoranda, or similar property written by an individual while serving as an officer or employee, excluding personal items, and qualified artistic contributions where tangible property and copyright are treated separately. Effective Date: The amendment applies to contributions made after the date of the enactment of this Act in taxable years ending after such date.
